intro: Cyphostemma caerulans, commonly known as the blue milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers, which are typically clustered in racemes. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a waxy texture. Cyphostemma caerulans is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
